unnormalised: Okay folks, let's talk rental yields! Seems complicated, but it's actually pretty straightforward. Think of it as your annual return on investment from renting out your property.
normalised: Okay folks, let's talk rental yields! Seems complicated, but it's actually pretty straightforward. Think of it as your annual return on investment from renting out your property.

unnormalised: Basically, it's (Annual Rental Income / Property Value) x 100. Simple, right?
normalised: Basically, it's open parenthesis Annual Rental Income divided by Property Value close parenthesis multiplied by one hundred. Simple, right?

unnormalised: So, let's say you own a 2 BHK flat in Powai, Mumbai, worth Rs. 1.5 crore. You rent it out for Rs. 40,000 per month. That's Rs. 4,80,000 per year. Your rental yield is (Rs. 4,80,000 / Rs. 1,50,00,000) x 100 = 3.2%.
normalised: So, let's say you own a two B H K flat in Powai, Mumbai, worth rupee one point five crore. You rent it out for rupee forty thousand per month. That's rupee four lakh eighty thousand per year. Your rental yield is open parenthesis rupee four lakh eighty thousand divided by rupee one crore fifty lakh close parenthesis multiplied by one hundred equals three point two percent.

unnormalised: Is 3.2% good? Well, it depends! Location matters. A similar property in Bangalore might fetch a different yield. Also, consider your expenses – property taxes, maintenance charges (that leaking tap!), and maybe even the broker's commission if you used one like NoBroker. These all eat into your profit.
